result.execSummary:
The defendant Casey A Guay was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Attempt Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to pay all court costs from count 1, supervision fees and any costs of treatment as a condition of probation on counts 7,8.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Casey A Guay

defendant.name: Guay, Casey A
defendant.address: 1201 S Spring Street, C/O Ozaukee County Jail, Port Washington, WI 53074

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: for Jail Furlough; copies provided to jail, Atty Penkwitz, District Attorney's office, defendant

Defendant Casey A Guay in court with attorney Michael Girard Penkwitz.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel requests sentence modification to allow defendant to be able to move into the dorms for college and start school on Sept 6; or if defendant could serve remaining sentence during school break. State opposes modification of the sentence, but has no objection to a restructuring of the sentence for remaining days. Court restructures sentence; defendant released from jail on August 28 to return December 26. Court grants huber privileges for counseling, school, medical and AA meetings. While defendant is out, bail conditions are reinstated. Atty Penkwitz will prepare order.
Defendant's Motion to Modify sentence.   Scanned and forwarded as document for review to Branch 2 clerk .
Attorney Penkwitz called the court requesting motion date. Clerk provided August 11, 2016 at 11:00 am. Motion for sentence modification will be filed with said date.
Stipulation and Order for Jail Funeral Fulough.
Stipulation and Proposed Order for Jail Funeral Furlough executed by both parties.  Scanned and forwarded to Branch 2 for review.

records.descr: Amended Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt: Court grants motion and huber privileges amended to 30 hours per week. No objection by the State.
for huber privilege school hour modification filed by Atty Penkwitz - scanned & forwarded to B2.

records.descr: Amended Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt: Per court directive, judgment of conviction to be amended to reflect huber privileges for schooling and a total of 20 hours per week commencing December 1, 2015.

Attorney Penkwitz left message regarding the request for Huber privileges to attend college starting in 1-2016.  Clerk was unable to reach Attorney Penkwitz on 11-25-2015, will try again on next business day.
Letter filed by Atty Penkwitz, requesting huber. Scanned & forwarded to Branch 2
Revoked - Sentenced to Co. Jail/HOC

Defendant Casey A Guay in court with attorney Michael Girard Penkwitz.  Defendant in custody. Shannon M. Whitworth appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Revocation on counts 7 and 8. State makes recommendation. Counsel addresses court. Defendant addresses court. Court makes findings and renders sentence. Court withholds huber privileges at this time. Attorney Penkwitz to file request in writing before January. If huber is granted at that time, it will be limited to school and no more than 20 hours per week.
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 10-28-2015 01:30 pm

Conditions set by court:  Court orders absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.  No use or possession of controlled substances unless valid prescription and in original containers. No possession of any type of weapons. No contact with victims in complaint.

Defendant Casey A Guay in court with attorney Michael Girard Penkwitz.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears by video conferencing from Ozaukee County Jail.  Counsel received copy of complaint, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty. Probable cause found. State requests $3000 cash bail with no contact conditions.  Further proceedings scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
